de.ryanthara.ja.rycon.io

Class LineReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ryanthara.ja.rycon.io.LineReader

  • public class LineReader
extends java.lang.Object
    LineReader reads a file line by line and stores it's values in an {code ArrayList}.

    A couple of things are implemented as additional functionality. At the moment, there is no thread safety implemented or planed.

    Changes:

    • 3: stop reading empty lines
    • 2: code improvements and clean up
    • 1: basic implementation
    Since:
    1

    • Method Detail

      • getCountReadLines

        public int getCountReadLines()
        Return the number of read lines.

        By default the value is set to -1, which shows, that no line has been read.

        Returns:
        number of read lines

      • getCountStoredLines

        public int getCountStoredLines()
        Return the number of stored lines.

        By default the value is set to -1, which shows, that no read line has been stored to the ArrayList<String>.

        Returns:
        number of stored lines

      • getLines

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getLines()
        Return the read lines as an ArrayList<String> object.

        The ArrayList<String> contains every read line, first line on top.s

        Returns:
        read lines as ArrayList<String> object

      • readFile

        public boolean readFile()
        Read a file line by line and return the read success.
        Returns:
        success of file reading
